OpenMined Privacy Tech Fellowship 2026 (Remote)

Remote fellowship to build privacy-preserving ML tools in the OpenMined ecosystem.

CompanyOpenMined
RolePrivacy Tech Fellow
LocationRemote
Duration10–12 weeks
StipendExpected/Indicative: stipend if funded; some tracks volunteer
Work HoursFull-time remote
Employment TypeIntern
ExperiencePython/ML background; OSS interest

Eligibility & Skills

  • Students/early-career engineers with Python/ML and interest in privacy tech
  • Education: UG/PG or professionals
  • Branches allowed: Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Electronics
  • Skills: Python, Machine learning, Security/privacy basics, Git and async collaboration
  • Year of study: UG/PG or recent grads
  • Age limit: Per program policy

OpenMined Privacy Tech Fellowship 2026 (Remote)

Introduction

OpenMined supports privacy-preserving machine learning. This remote fellowship lets you build libraries and examples in that ecosystem. Dates/stipend are Expected/Indicative.

Program Overview

  • Remote collaboration with maintainers
  • Work on secure aggregation, federated learning, or privacy tooling
  • Weekly milestones; stipend if funded

Eligibility

  • Python/ML skills and OSS familiarity
  • Ability to work async for 10–12 weeks

How to Apply

  1. Contribute small fixes to OpenMined repos. 2) Submit application with proposal and links. 3) Complete any screening task.

FAQs

  • Paid? Expected/Indicative: stipend if funded; some tracks volunteer.
  • Remote? Fully remote.
  • Need prior privacy background? Basics suffice; demonstrate learning ability.

Ready to apply?

Applications close on 18 March 2026.
